Package agile.planner.scripter.functional

Class State

  • java.lang.Object
    • agile.planner.scripter.functional.State
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AddState, BoardState, CardState, CheckListState, DayState, EditState, ExportState, FunctionState, ImportState, LabelState, PreProcessorState, PrintState, RemoveState, TaskState
    public abstract class State
extends java.lang.Object
    The class State serves as parent class to all functions and classes within the Simple language. It is responsible for managing the various states, stacks for variable usage, and string processing of provided code snippets. It utilizes ScriptContext as its preprocess handler when dealing with the construction of custom functions and updating flags for built-in operations such as logging or debug support to the user. State utilizes a modified version of State Pattern as a means of performing context switches amongst various classes, functions, and preprocessor flags.

    Simple utilizes dynamic variable storage with its constant recall from the Stack of the most recently created instance of a class. While users can specify a certain index, it is not necessary as long as they utilize a '_' before the class type. This saves time and reduces error as can be seen here: 

         task: hw, 3, 0  <-- [T0]
     task: rd, 4, 0  <-- [T1]
     print: _task    <-- prints [T1]
     print: _task 0  <-- prints [T0]

    The State class also serves as a context handler with regards to managing states and storing all relevant data. The core identifier for a type is the ':'. It follows the very first token and is accompanied by arguments provided if any. Below demonstrates the three kinds of types a user will typically encounter: 

         __LOG__              <-- preprocessor flag
     print: _task         <-- pre-built function
     card: Math           <-- class
     foo: _task, _card    <-- custom function

    String processing is also provided via State to offer all child classes the option to call one of its utility methods. This includes parsing arguments for a class/function or parsing tokens from an entire code statement: 

         processArguments("task: hw, 3, 0") --> ["hw", "3", "0"]
     processTokens("print: _task")      --> ["print", "_task"]

    The State class has all its fields protected and static to ensure ease of access for all children classes to the stack and preprocessor attributes.

    As for exceptions, there are various circumstances that will result in a RuntimeException being thrown. The first deals with a case of the user attempting to recall a Task from an empty stack, resulting in a DereferenceNullException being thrown. Another situation involving an unknown type will result in an UnknownClassException. Finally, when the string processing method encounters more tokens/arguments than previously expected, an InvalidGrammarException will occur.

    Since:
    1.0
